headline: How to Make Pico de Gallo
description: This quick and easy recipe shows you how to make pico de gallo using simple, fresh ingredients like tomatoes, jalapeños, and onions. Perfect as an appetizer.

video.description: Once you serve the pico de gallo recipe from this video with your Mexican dish such as tacos, you will want it with all your Mexican dishes! Forget about salsa, and serve this instead!
video.name: How to Make Pico de Gallo

name: How to Make Pico de Gallo

recipeInstructions.text: Combine tomato, onion, jalapeño pepper, cilantro and green onion in a medium bowl. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Stir until evenly distributed.

review.reviewBody: I prefer fresh garlic to garlic powder. Also I used Roma tomatoes so one is not enough. I didn't add green onions because it's not in the version my Mexican friends taught me. Plus I used the whole large jalepeno cause we like the heat.

Wow this was so great, I did add the juice of one lime to mine! Made this along with guacamole from this site for fourth of July and it was a huge hit! Scrambled the left overs into eggs the next day and it was out of this world!!!
I think it is better if you use balsamic vine Rhee or shrimp paste instead of lime juice in the mixture.

I love this kind of salsa and it’s the only kind I’ve ever made. We change up the peppers we use sometimes. Ancho or poblano are good. Our garden was planted to be a salsa/guacamole/margarita garden. What really bumped it up was using a traditional molcajete to mash the garlic, onion and cilantro in lime juice. Our latest fun twist is Datil peppers only found in Saint Augustine, FL. Wonderful flavor with a slow heat that scares you the first time cuz you don’t know where it stopping. It’s not that bad though. I’d say it’s less heat than a jalapeño. An easy cheat to preserve it a little longer- a squirt of catsup-the no sugar kind.
Great place to start! Play with the ingredients and see what YOU like best. Thanks for the recipe.
This was sooooo good. I eat mexican almost every day because I'm vegetarian so now I will be making this regularly.
Nice, simple, and tasty!
Perfect as is.
So good! The only changes I made was no cilantro and added more garlic. I was buying my pico from store until I found this recipe. Now I am addicted!
lacks a main ingredient, lime.
Great recipe. Quick and easy. My wife loved it, she wants me to make it a couple of time a week. She uses it on everything including her salads.
simple recipe, very tasty! I added a tsp of sugar and some lime juice for extra freshness!
Missing one key ingredient....fresh lime juice!!
this is excellent over chicken tacos or any other mexican dish . oras a dip with tortilla chips
Everyone liked it. I will make it again but I will add a little more tomato.
OOOh so good using everything out of our garden. Put up 11 quarts of it.
This is very tasty. I used it to add to my Budda Bowl recipe in place of jarred salsa.
Yum! Hubby loved it. Getting ready to màke one more batch that is spicier. Great flavors.
Great recipe! I used red onion and added the juice of 1 lime. I let it sit for about 30 minutes, before serving. It was delicious.
It's not terrible, but I have to rate it as Mediocre at best, but I want a stronger, yet mild flavor (good jalapeno flavor without the "heat").
Great basic recipe I did use 3 garlic cloves minced , juice from 1 lime and diced banana peppers out of my garden. My husband was eating it with a spoon straight out of the bowl.
Delicious! I doubled the recipe. I used 2 cloves of garlic , red onion and a lot more cilantro.
#1 on my list!!!
This was pretty good. I added avocado to mine and skipped the green onion. I used a white onion, but I think I'll use a red one next time.
I made my husbands day when I made this!
Easy to put together and tasted great.
Needs lime juice and omit the pepper. Salt to taste.
Definitely would make it again. To give it more of a kick use a serrano pepper rather than jalepeno.

My husband is very picky about Mexican dishes and he loved it! Said it was absolutely delicious! Unfortunately I did not have fresh cilantro, but the dried worked quite well! I used about 1 to 1 1/2 teaspoon.
made it love it, and it was good, all people that saw my pictures said it looked good, but no samples out due to I ate it all, oh well

Great. Just made a few adjustment. I used a Vadalia onion instead of the Red. Also and Very Important, Add LIME JUICE to it. The difference is huge. When making it, I diced up the onions put them in a bowl with a little salt on them to the side ( few minutes ) then drained. It pulls out the bitterness
Use one clove of fresh garlic finely chopped and a small handful of Cilantro sprigs coarsely chopped instead of a few or powdered garlic.
Excellent I loved it and so did my family. I added some red onions and lime juice other than that the recipe is perfect!
I love it!

Trying again to leave comment. I usually don’t leave anything other than the star ratings. I personally don’t care for reading negative comments about another’s recipes. I feel thankful that they took time out of their busy lives to share it with us. It’s a good recipe. If it helps you to see what your missing to make the dish complete or so your able to make your own come out better. Most are making a dish for the first time so try to be appreciative to the recipient of the recipe. Give the recipe a rating. If you feel a comment is necessary try to be nice & helpful....not rude, big headed or a know it all. If your incapable......move on. It’s rude to start off telling them they have left out several ingredients or as most put, the “key” ingredient. Obviously it is to their satisfaction, and others likings or they would not have posted it. Each to their own I say and of course most of all........BRAVO!!!! Im a wife of 17yrs & mother of 2 healthy eating boys. I’m told by so many that I’m an amazing cook but I’ve never been brave enough to post one of my recipes, out of fear of being ridiculed so I’m happy to have another’s to try. I feel lucky enough to have access to all the wonderful technology this day in time to find recipes and help with my own recipes but I will never act as if I know what another’s recipe needs to be perfect. Thanks, LeLesBoys03
Nice! Simple and tasty.

I don't eat Pico but lots of my family does. I substituted homegrown onions for my batch but it was a massive hit! There were only 2 people eating it and I have none left! Definitely a great simple addition to the party!
I like this basic recipe! It’s great for a quick pico! Usually ingredients I have on hand. Thank you for sharing!
To lime or not to lime, a little jalapeno or a lot of jalapeno, to each their own. This recipe is the perfect jumping off spot for a pico de gallo to your liking.

It came out great! I HIGHLY recommend adding in a splash of lime juice (fresh, to taste) and a little more of each spice to taste. It was a little bland until I added more of each spice. But a great base recipe!
Great recipe; similar to the pico made by a good friend (except she doesn't like cilantro). This will be my go-to pico recipe.

I made the pico de gallo as is and it was delicious. I used it as a topping to the fish tacos, which added a nice touch 
The family loved It Thank you for sharing your recipe
I can always rely on this site
Very good, made exactly as the recipe says. It tastes just like the pico de gallo I can buy at my local grocery store.
Perfect, at least as good as what we get at our favorite Veracruzana restaurant. Wow!
Very flavorful, pretty basic pico.
added corn to ingredients. Use to make a Moe's dinner at home
Best Pico de Gallo ever. Simple to prepare
No pepper and a whole limes worth of juice made this perfect! Imo :)

I have now made this twice in one week. Love it. I find myself using it on burgers, in burritos & on many other dishes that needs some flavoring + the bonus is that it's all fresh ingredients & home made.
I had everything on hand except the jalapeno and green onion, but it was still delicious! I squeeze a whole lime and mix into all the ingredients. I'll never buy it from the store again!
Good basic recipe. Based on the reviews I cut down on the onion, used fresh garlic, and added some lemon juice.
Delicious. Use 1 cup to 1 and 1/2 cups diced, fresh tomato. Left out jalapenos.
easy to make and delicious!!!
I used a red onion because I didn't have a white or yellow & I squeezed some lime juice over it. Other than that, it was wonderful.
Excellent recipe! i added a little zip with smoked paprika.

Like many others said, it is a basic recipe. I used 4 tomatoes, 1 large onion and several kinds of peppers from the garden to add interest. I made a larger batch because who wants to make that much of a mess for such a small amount:-)
Easy to make and delicious!
This was really good. I followed some other comments regarding the lime juice. I also added the zest of one lime to it. I will make this again, and probably a lot.
I followed some recommendations and used fresh lemon juice but the rest I left as is....great and easy. Thanks!!
It was an ok recipe, but needed some tweaking. I added lime juice and used fresh garlic instead of garlic powder. I would also add more cilantro next time.
This is great for a quick and easy way to make Pico de Gallo. I thought it was very good. I will definitely make it again.
added a little twist- more peppers-lime- fresh garlic and a dash of salt less seasoning
Beautiful, easy, and fast. We always use fresh garlic, but otherwise an excellent recipe! No need ever to buy salsa! Thanks for the lovely recipe!

Great Recipe! We use Roma tomatoes seeded skin on cut in chunks and multiply this 7 times or so lol. It is fantastic the way it is but we add a couple tablespoons of vegetable oil and the juice of one lime.

I had a few veggies from a late garden harvest and wanted a quick, fresh pico de gallo. This recipe was perfect. I only substituted fresh garlic for the garlic salt (I didn't have the garlic salt). I served it on my veggie omelet and it was outstanding.

My husband loved it. I did make a few changes, some intentional and others by accident.

I skipped the jalapeno, forgot the green onion (will include next time) and added a little lime juice.
I didn't care for this recipe.
Probably would have been 5 Stars if the recipe called for Lime Juice, I did add some sliced Black Olives. still way better then store bought Salsa

Like most reviewers lime and minced garlic are a must have. I've made pico a dozen different ways and enjoy it with a couple tabs of sugar to sweeten it and reduce the acidity a bit. Other options include red wine vinegar or some old world jalepano infused vinegar. Have fun with pico! Fresh Roma's, best to de- seed (pam says always take the snot out!!!) of your maters, any onion, cilantro and a good pepper are the bedrock of a good dip or seafood, chicken,pork garnish. Gotta love Mexican food.
I used green peppers instead of jalapeno and I didn't have green onions. I added lime juice since so many recommended it and I agree. It needs something to tie all the pieces together.

I used 2 tomatoes since I have a lot from my garden since I can't handle really spicey foods I used a Yellow wax chile pepper which are a lot milder than Jalapeno's. first time making Pico de gallo for me and I loved it so I know I will be messin around with it doing different things depending on whats in my garden but now I have a basic recipe
Perfect as is. I didn't make it spicy, but that's worth trying next time!
I used this recipe for making Tacos, adding the cheese and putting in the mic for a minute.

I make Pico all the time and this recipe is definitely off. It's a good starting point but the amount of tomato to onion is really wrong - I use 3 or 4 tomatoes to 1 onion. I add a lot more cilantro because we really like it and 2 sprigs is almost none - why bother? Fresh garlic is a must - just put it through a garlic press and it adds so much more flavor. With herbs and spices, fresh is always better. Last of all, lime juice is required. I'd use at least 1 whole lemon, juiced - about 2 T. or even 3. Sorry but if I have to correct the recipe it's never a 5 star. I rate the recipe as stated, not as I make it.
I really really like this. It's so simple yet everything it has in it just makes it so good. I totally didn't change a thing.

loved it! Didn't have cilantro and didn't miss it a bit. Added squeeze of lime per other reviewers. I'll keep some of this on hand from now on. Fresh and light!
Fast and easy.

I loved this recipe except I found the onions to really over power the dish and I also added the lime juice. That was a must! Next time I will be putting the onions in a hot water bath to soften the kick of them, otherwise this was a great and simple recipe.
Incredibly delicious! Loved the little bit of spice and it was easy to make!

Soooo delicious. I swapped out the green onion for red because I was already using green onion in a different taco topper I was making, and I also used fresh garlic instead of powder and added a splash of lime juice. Will make this a staple side with all Mexican dishes from now on.

This was amazingly good. I did, however, add a few squirts of Lemon juice and Lime Juice to give it a little extra pizzazz. Took it to a party where a few guests are regular travelers to Mexico, and received high praise from them :) absolutely delish!!
I added some green pepper. It was good.

This was just okay as written. However, after tasting it, I did add some lime juice and diced red onion, which is just my personal preference. It's okay without it. Really yummy with my chips, and I can't stop eating it!
I used more tomato than the recipe called for as I love tomato.. this was hands down DELICIOUS!!
Absolutely delicious. Wish I would have made more. Can't wait to make this for my house warming. :)

The ratio of onion to tomato is waytoo high, there need to be way less onion, or way more tomato. There is no lime, and there needs to be fresh garlic, never powdered. Also, there needs to be more cilantro, as well as a little bit of green bell pepper.
Awesome, will make again for sure
Very simple and delish. Thank you!
It's a good starting base. But I always add a little more tomatoes and I add lime juice.

This recipe is OK for beginners. I had used 3 small/medium red vine tomatoes, 1 whole jalapeno, 1 whole yellow onion, like 3 times the cilantro, a couple shakes of salt and pepper and little less garlic powder, one green onion and about 1 lime juice. I really used this as a guide line more than anything. But for first timers this recipe is fine. Just dont put too much salt it will draw the water out of the tomatoes and make the pico de gallo watery.
It's a very good Pico de Gallo. Simple to make and great taste to go with quesadillas!
I used regular onions and too many, but it still is delicious. I also substituted poblanos on hand.
Not what I expected. Not very tasty had to add more peppers.
Not enough tomatoes, cilantro, or jalapeño, too much onion, no lemon or lime juice.
Loved it. So tasty! Added lime juice and more salt. Yum!
This delicious recipe has changed my husband and I into Pico dippers rather than salsa! Love it! :-)
No changes. Yes, will definitely make again.
Super yummy!!! GREAT basic recipe! So delicious, will definitely be making this over and over

Excellent base recipe!! I made it for a friend and we both thought it was better than the fresh at the farm market in her neighborhood. My five-star rating is based upon the recipe itself; however, I did make some very basic alterations. I used roma tomatoes and used three for the one tomato as listed in the recipe. I did not use green onion as I missed that in the list so I didn't have any, but I doubled the recipe (using six roma tomatoes) and used one full, medium-sized onion. I chopped the tomatoes, onion and pepper very fine. I also substituted one large clove of garlic (minced very fine) for the garlic powder. I don't feel as though my alterations were much of a departure from the original recipe, and it was delicious! Exactly what I was looking for! When I served it, I squeezed a half a lime over the bowl and stirred it together. YUM!!! Oh, I did use A LOT more cilantro - love cilantro!

item.name: How to Make Pico de Gallo
